description: A single issue - either an indication, contraindication, interaction or an undesirable effect for a medicinal product, medication, device or procedure.

constraint.human: Indication, Contraindication, Interaction, UndesirableEffect and Warning cannot be used in the same instance

element.definition: A single issue - either an indication, contraindication, interaction or an undesirable effect for a medicinal product, medication, device or procedure.

mapping.map: Contraindication, Therapeutic Indication, Interactions, Undesirable Effects

element.short: A single issue - either an indication, contraindication, interaction or an undesirable effect for a medicinal product, medication, device or procedure

element.definition: Business identifier for this issue.
element.short: Business identifier for this issue

binding.description: Overall defining type of this clinical use definition.

element.definition: indication | contraindication | interaction | undesirable-effect | warning.

mapping.map: (the type of IDMP class, out of Contraindication, Therapeutic Indication, Interactions, Undesirable Effects)

element.short: indication | contraindication | interaction | undesirable-effect | warning

binding.description: A categorisation for a clinical use information item.

element.definition: A categorisation of the issue, primarily for dividing warnings into subject heading areas such as "Pregnancy and Lactation", "Overdose", "Effects on Ability to Drive and Use Machines".
element.short: A categorisation of the issue, primarily for dividing warnings into subject heading areas such as "Pregnancy", "Overdose"

element.definition: The medication or procedure for which this is an indication.

mapping.map: (the link between the IDMP class and Medicinal Product)

element.short: The medication or procedure for which this is an indication

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.definition: Whether this is a current issue or one that has been retired etc.
element.short: Whether this is a current issue or one that has been retired etc

element.definition: Specifics for when this is a contraindication.
element.short: Specifics for when this is a contraindication

binding.description: A symptom, disease or procedure.

element.definition: The situation that is being documented as contraindicating against this item.

mapping.map: Contraindication.Contraindications as "Disease / Symptom / Procedure" and Contraindication.Contraindications Text

element.short: The situation that is being documented as contraindicating against this item

binding.description: The status of a disease or symptom.

element.definition: The status of the disease or symptom for the contraindication, for example "chronic" or "metastatic".
element.short: The status of the disease or symptom for the contraindication

binding.description: A symptom, disease or procedure.

element.definition: A comorbidity (concurrent condition) or coinfection.
element.short: A comorbidity (concurrent condition) or coinfection

element.definition: The indication which this is a contraidication for.

mapping.map: (the link from Contraindication to Therapeutic Indication)

element.short: The indication which this is a contraidication for

element.definition: Information about the use of the medicinal product in relation to other therapies described as part of the contraindication.
element.short: Information about use of the product in relation to other therapies described as part of the contraindication

binding.description: Classification of relationship between a therapy and a contraindication or an indication.

element.definition: The type of relationship between the medicinal product indication or contraindication and another therapy.
element.short: The type of relationship between the product indication/contraindication and another therapy

binding.description: A therapy.

element.definition: Reference to a specific medication (active substance, medicinal product or class of products) as part of an indication or contraindication.
element.short: Reference to a specific medication as part of an indication or contraindication

element.definition: Specifics for when this is an indication.
element.short: Specifics for when this is an indication

binding.description: A symptom, disease or procedure.

element.definition: The situation that is being documented as an indicaton for this item.

mapping.map: Therapeutic Indication.Indication as "Disease / Symptom / Procedure", and Therapeutic Indication.Indication Text

element.short: The situation that is being documented as an indicaton for this item

binding.description: The status of a disease or symptom.

element.definition: The status of the disease or symptom for the indication, for example "chronic" or "metastatic".
element.short: The status of the disease or symptom for the indication

binding.description: A symptom, disease or procedure.

element.definition: A comorbidity (concurrent condition) or coinfection as part of the indication.
element.short: A comorbidity or coinfection as part of the indication

binding.description: The overall intended use of a product.

element.definition: The intended effect, aim or strategy to be achieved.
element.short: The intended effect, aim or strategy to be achieved

element.definition: Timing or duration information, that may be associated with use with the indicated condition e.g. Adult patients suffering from myocardial infarction (from a few days until less than 35 days), ischaemic stroke (from 7 days until less than 6 months).
element.short: Timing or duration information

element.definition: An unwanted side effect or negative outcome that may happen if you use the drug (or other subject of this resource) for this indication.
element.short: An unwanted side effect or negative outcome of the subject of this resource when being used for this indication

element.definition: Information about the use of the medicinal product in relation to other therapies described as part of the indication.
element.short: The use of the medicinal product in relation to other therapies described as part of the indication

element.definition: Specifics for when this is an interaction.
element.short: Specifics for when this is an interaction

element.definition: The specific medication, food, substance or laboratory test that interacts.
element.short: The specific medication, food, substance or laboratory test that interacts

binding.description: An interactant - a substance that may have an clinically significant effect on another.

element.definition: The specific medication, food or laboratory test that interacts.
element.short: The specific medication, food or laboratory test that interacts

binding.description: A categorisation for an interaction between two substances.

element.definition: The type of the interaction e.g. drug-drug interaction, drug-food interaction, drug-lab test interaction.
element.short: The type of the interaction e.g. drug-drug interaction, drug-lab test interaction

binding.description: A interaction effect of clinical use of a medication or other substance.

element.definition: The effect of the interaction, for example "reduced gastric absorption of primary medication".
element.short: The effect of the interaction, for example "reduced gastric absorption of primary medication"

binding.description: A categorisation for incidence of occurence of an interaction.

element.definition: The incidence of the interaction, e.g. theoretical, observed.
element.short: The incidence of the interaction, e.g. theoretical, observed

binding.description: A type of management for an interaction of a medication or other substance.

element.definition: Actions for managing the interaction.
element.short: Actions for managing the interaction

element.definition: The population group to which this applies.
element.short: The population group to which this applies

element.definition: Describe the possible undesirable effects (negative outcomes) from the use of the medicinal product as treatment.
element.short: A possible negative outcome from the use of this treatment

binding.description: An undesirable effect of clinical use.

element.definition: The situation in which the undesirable effect may manifest.

mapping.map: Undesirable Effects.Undesirable Effect as "Symptom / Condition / Effect"

element.short: The situation in which the undesirable effect may manifest

binding.description: A categorisation for an undesirable effect.

element.definition: High level classification of the effect.
element.short: High level classification of the effect

binding.description: A categorisation for a frequency of occurence of an undesirable effect.

element.definition: How often the effect is seen.
element.short: How often the effect is seen

element.definition: A critical piece of information about environmental, health or physical risks or hazards that serve as caution to the user. For example 'Do not operate heavy machinery', 'May cause drowsiness', or 'Get medical advice/attention if you feel unwell'.
element.short: Critical environmental, health or physical risks or hazards. For example 'Do not operate heavy machinery', 'May cause drowsiness'

element.definition: A textual definition of this warning, with formatting.
element.short: A textual definition of this warning, with formatting

binding.description: Classification of warning type.

element.definition: A coded or unformatted textual definition of this warning.
element.short: A coded or unformatted textual definition of this warning

name: ClinicalUseDefinition
publisher: Health Level Seven International (Biomedical Research and Regulation)

constraint.human: Indication, Contraindication, Interaction, UndesirableEffect and Warning cannot be used in the same instance
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources

constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.definition: A single issue - either an indication, contraindication, interaction or an undesirable effect for a medicinal product, medication, device or procedure.

mapping.map: Contraindication, Therapeutic Indication, Interactions, Undesirable Effects

element.short: A single issue - either an indication, contraindication, interaction or an undesirable effect for a medicinal product, medication, device or procedure

element.comment: Within the context of the FHIR RESTful interactions, the resource has an id except for cases like the create and conditional update. Otherwise, the use of the resouce id depends on the given use case.
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.short: Logical id of this artifact

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.
element.short: Metadata about the resource

element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation
element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created

binding.description: IETF language tag

element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.short: Language of the resource content

element.comment: Contained resources do not have a narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.short: Contained, inline Resources

element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

binding.description: An interactant - a substance that may have an clinically significant effect on another.

binding.description: A interaction effect of clinical use of a medication or other substance.

element.short: The effect of the interaction, for example "reduced gastric absorption of primary medication"

text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
ClinicalUseDefinition TUDomainResourceA single issue - either an indication, contraindication, interaction or an undesirable effect for a medicinal product, medication, device or procedure
+ Rule: Indication, Contraindication, Interaction, UndesirableEffect and Warning cannot be used in the same instance
Elements defined in Ancestors: id, meta, implicitRules, language, text, contained, extension, modifierExtension
identifier 0..*IdentifierBusiness identifier for this issue
type 1..1codeindication | contraindication | interaction | undesirable-effect | warning
ClinicalUseDefinitionType (Required)
category 0..*CodeableConceptA categorisation of the issue, primarily for dividing warnings into subject heading areas such as "Pregnancy", "Overdose"
ClinicalUseDefinitionCategory (Preferred)
subject 0..*Reference(MedicinalProductDefinition | Medication | ActivityDefinition | PlanDefinition | Device | DeviceDefinition | Substance)The medication or procedure for which this is an indication
status 0..1CodeableConceptWhether this is a current issue or one that has been retired etc
PublicationStatus (Preferred)
contraindication 0..1BackboneElementSpecifics for when this is a contraindication
diseaseSymptomProcedure 0..1CodeableReference(ObservationDefinition)The situation that is being documented as contraindicating against this item
DiseaseSymptomProcedure (Example)
diseaseStatus 0..1CodeableReference(ObservationDefinition)The status of the disease or symptom for the contraindication
DiseaseStatus (Example)
comorbidity 0..*CodeableReference(ObservationDefinition)A comorbidity (concurrent condition) or coinfection
DiseaseSymptomProcedure (Example)
indication 0..*Reference(ClinicalUseDefinition)The indication which this is a contraidication for
otherTherapy 0..*BackboneElementInformation about use of the product in relation to other therapies described as part of the contraindication
relationshipType 1..1CodeableConceptThe type of relationship between the product indication/contraindication and another therapy
TherapyRelationshipType (Preferred)
therapy 1..1CodeableReference(MedicinalProductDefinition | Medication | Substance | SubstanceDefinition | ActivityDefinition)Reference to a specific medication as part of an indication or contraindication
Therapy (Example)
indication 0..1BackboneElementSpecifics for when this is an indication
diseaseSymptomProcedure 0..1CodeableReference(ObservationDefinition)The situation that is being documented as an indicaton for this item
DiseaseSymptomProcedure (Example)
diseaseStatus 0..1CodeableReference(ObservationDefinition)The status of the disease or symptom for the indication
DiseaseStatus (Example)
comorbidity 0..*CodeableReference(ObservationDefinition)A comorbidity or coinfection as part of the indication
DiseaseSymptomProcedure (Example)
intendedEffect 0..1CodeableReference(ObservationDefinition)The intended effect, aim or strategy to be achieved
ProductIntendedUse (Preferred)
duration[x] 0..1Timing or duration information
durationRangeRange
durationStringstring
undesirableEffect 0..*Reference(ClinicalUseDefinition)An unwanted side effect or negative outcome of the subject of this resource when being used for this indication
otherTherapy 0..*see otherTherapyThe use of the medicinal product in relation to other therapies described as part of the indication
interaction 0..1BackboneElementSpecifics for when this is an interaction
interactant 0..*BackboneElementThe specific medication, food, substance or laboratory test that interacts
item[x] 1..1The specific medication, food or laboratory test that interacts
Interactant (Example)
itemReferenceReference(MedicinalProductDefinition | Medication | Substance | ObservationDefinition)
itemCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
type 0..1CodeableConceptThe type of the interaction e.g. drug-drug interaction, drug-lab test interaction
InteractionType (Example)
effect 0..1CodeableReference(ObservationDefinition)The effect of the interaction, for example "reduced gastric absorption of primary medication"
InteractionEffect (Example)
incidence 0..1CodeableConceptThe incidence of the interaction, e.g. theoretical, observed
UndesirableEffectSymptom (Example)
management 0..*CodeableConceptActions for managing the interaction
InteractionManagement (Example)
population 0..*Reference(Group)The population group to which this applies
undesirableEffect 0..1BackboneElementA possible negative outcome from the use of this treatment
symptomConditionEffect 0..1CodeableReference(ObservationDefinition)The situation in which the undesirable effect may manifest
UndesirableEffectSymptom (Example)
classification 0..1CodeableConceptHigh level classification of the effect
UndesirableEffectClassification (Example)
frequencyOfOccurrence 0..1CodeableConceptHow often the effect is seen
UndesirablEffectFrequency (Example)
warning 0..1BackboneElementCritical environmental, health or physical risks or hazards. For example 'Do not operate heavy machinery', 'May cause drowsiness'
description 0..1markdownA textual definition of this warning, with formatting
code 0..1CodeableConceptA coded or unformatted textual definition of this warning
WarningType (Example)

Documentation for this format
